isis.stitle: CF 500, CF 600 Brakes - Anti-Lock Control - 4-Wheel - Anti-Lock Control Diagnosis and Testing

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to the Wiring Diagrams for schematic and connector information.

step1.para: Verify the customer concern by operating the vehicle and applying the brakes under different conditions to duplicate the condition.
Inspect to determine if one of the following mechanical or electrical concerns apply:
If the inspection reveals an obvious concern(s) that can be readily identified, repair as required.

If the concern remains after the inspection, connect the diagnostic tool to the data link connector (DLC) located beneath the instrument panel and select the vehicle to be tested from the diagnostic tool menu. If the diagnostic tool does not communicate with the vehicle:

item.para: check that the program card is correctly installed.
check the connections to the vehicle.
verify that the battery voltage is between 10 and 16 volts. For additional information, refer to Charging System in S08307.

step1.para: If the diagnostic tool still does not communicate with the vehicle, refer to the diagnostic tool manual.
Carry out the DATA LINK DIAGNOSTIC TEST. If the diagnostic tool responds with:

item.para: CKT914, CKT915 or CKT70 = ALL ECUS NO RESP/NOT EQUIP, refer to Module Communications Network in S08307.
NO RESP/NOT EQUIP for anti-lock brake control module, GO to Pinpoint Test L.
SYSTEM PASSED, retrieve and record the continuous diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs), erase the continuous DTCs and carry out self-test diagnostics for the anti-lock brake system module.

step1.para: If the DTCs retrieved are related to the concern, refer to Anti-Lock Brake System (ABS) Module Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC) Index to continue diagnostics.
If no DTCs related to the concern are retrieved, to continue diagnostics.

svcsubproc.title: Symptom Chart
svcsubproc.para: Failure of a mechanical brake component may not cause the yellow ABS warning indicator to illuminate or a DTC to be stored. The Symptom Chart is a starting point to begin diagnosis of these concerns.

entry.para: No communication with the ABS module
ABS misfire, ABS too sensitive, ABS fires on normal stop

item.para: Rear wheel speed sensor ring is damaged.
Front wheel speed sensor ring is damaged.
Sensor output is out of sync.
Chafed wire insulation or pinched wire due to incorrect routing causing intermittent short.
REMOVE rear wheel speed sensor from the differential housing; INSPECT the rear wheel speed sensor.
INSPECT for damaged teeth. INSPECT both front wheel speed sensor rings.
INSPECT wiring harness from front wheel knuckle-to-frame and from the rear axle-to-frame for worn or chafed wire insulation.
ELIMINATE base brake system as cause of problem.
TIGHTEN wheel speed sensor bolt to specifications. REFER to Specifications.
Leaky ABS inlet (isolation) valve during ABS (soft).
Damp or contaminated rear brake linings, or stuck/leaking rear disc brake caliper.
ELIMINATE base brake system as cause of problem. REFER to Brake System.

entry.para: Yellow ABS warning indicator does not illuminate at prove out

item.para: Refer to Instrument Cluster in S08307.
Stuck ABS inlet (isolation) valve (hard brake pedal) or leaky ABS outlet (dump) valve (soft brake pedal).
Hydraulic leak in brake line or hose, fitting, master cylinder or caliper (soft brake pedal).
Air in brake system (soft brake pedal).
Little or no power assist (hard brake pedal).
Stuck or inoperative caliper (hard brake pedal).
Pinched or crimped brake line or hose (hard brake pedal).
ELIMINATE base brake system as cause of problem. REFER to Brake System.

entry.para: Lack of deceleration during medium/hard brake application

item.para: Stuck shut ABS inlet (isolation) valve or leaky ABS outlet (dump) valve (rear axle only).
Hydraulic leak in brake line or hose, fitting, master cylinder or caliper.
ELIMINATE base brake system as cause of problem. REFER to Brake System.
Frozen or binding brake caliper (one side of vehicle).
Pinched or crimped brake line or hose.
Fully or partially blocked front ABS inlet (isolation) valve.
ELIMINATE base brake system as cause of problem. REFER to Brake System.
INSTALL a new hydraulic control unit (HCU). REFER to Hydraulic Control Unit in this section.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test A: No Communication with the ABS Module

caution.para: Use the Probe Kit for all test connections to prevent damage to the wiring terminals. Do not use standard multimeter probes.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST A: NO COMMUNICATION WITH THE ABS MODULE

para.emph: A1 VERIFY DIAGNOSTIC TOOL COMMUNICATION WITH THE VEHICLE

item.para: Connect the diagnostic tool to data link connector (DLC) C251.
Verify diagnostic tool communication with the vehicle.

para.emph: Does the network test pass for the engine control module (ECM)?

entry.para: REFER to the diagnostic tool manual for further diagnosis.

para.emph: A2 CHECK PDC FUSE 20 (60A) AND FUSE 29 (60A)

entry.para: CHECK and REPAIR PDC input side of the suspect fuse cavity. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A3 CHECK FOR VOLTAGE INPUT TO THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKE SYSTEM (ABS) MODULE

item.para: Measure the voltage between ABS module C135-2, circuit 601 (LB/PK), harness side and ground and between ABS module C135-32, circuit 489 (PK/BK).

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: REPAIR circuit 601 (LB/PK) or circuit 534 (YE/LG). TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A4 CHECK THE ABS MODULE GROUNDS

item.para: Measure the resistance between ABS module C135-16 circuit 530 (LG/YE), harness side and ground and between C135-45 circuit 57 (BK), harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: Refer to Module Communications Network in S08307.
REPAIR circuit 534 (YE/LG) or circuit 57 (BK). TEST the system for normal operation.

caution.para: Use the Probe Kit for all test connections to prevent damage to the wiring terminals. Do not use standard multimeter probes.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST B: DTCs B1317 AND B1318 - BATTERY VOLTAGE HIGH/LOW

item.para: Measure the battery voltage between the positive and negative battery posts with the key ON engine OFF (KOEO) and with the engine running.

para.emph: Is the battery voltage between 10 and 13 volts with KOEO and between 11 and 16 volts with the engine running?

entry.para: CHECK the charging system. REFER to Charging System in S08307. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: B2 CHECK THE VOLTAGE TO THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKE SYSTEM (ABS) MODULE

item.para: Measure the voltage between ABS module C135-2, circuit 601 (LB/PK), harness side and ground; and between ABS module C135-32, circuit 489 (PK/BK) harness side and ground.

para.emph: Are the voltages greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: B3 CHECK THE ABS MODULE GROUNDS

item.para: Measure the resistance between ABS module C135-16 circuit 530 (LG/YE), harness side and ground; and between ABS module C135-45 circuit 57 (BK), harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: B4 CHECK FOR CORRECT ABS MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Connect the ABS connector and make sure that it is seated correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new ABS module. REFER to Anti-Lock Brake System Module in this section. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

caution.para: Use the Probe Kit for all test connections to prevent damage to the wiring terminals. Do not use standard multimeter probes.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST C: DTCs C1095 AND C1096 - ABS HYDRAULIC PUMP MOTOR CIRCUIT FAILURE/OPEN

para.emph: C1 CHECK THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKE SYSTEM (ABS) PUMP MOTOR
Does the ABS pump motor run continuously?

item.para: Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: ABS Module Active Command.
Trigger the ABS module pump motor ON active command.

para.emph: Does the ABS pump motor run for approximately 2 seconds?

entry.para: CLEAR the DTCs. CHECK the yellow ABS warning indicator while driving the vehicle (brakes must not be applied) above 32 km/h (20 mph). If the yellow ABS warning indicator illuminates, RETRIEVE the DTCs. If DTC C1096 is retrieved, GO to C5.
If DTC C1095 is retrieved, INSTALL a new HCU. REFER to Hydraulic Control Unit in this section. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.
TRIGGER the ABS module pump motor OFF active command. GO to C3.

item.para: Measure the voltage between ABS module C135-31, circuit 534 (YE/LG), harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: C4 CHECK THE ABS MODULE GROUNDS

item.para: Measure the resistance between ABS module C135-16 circuit 534 (YE/LG), harness side and ground; and between ABS module C135-45 circuit 57 (BK), harness side and ground.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new HCU. REFER to Hydraulic Control Unit in this section. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.
REPAIR the circuit. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: C5 CHECK FOR CORRECT ABS MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Connect the ABS connector and make sure that it is seated correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new ABS module. REFER to Anti-Lock Brake System Module in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

caution.para: Use the Probe Kit for all test connections to prevent damage to the wiring terminals. Do not use standard multimeter probes.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST D: DTC C1145 (RF), C1155 (LF) OR C1175 (REAR) - WHEEL SPEED SENSOR INPUT CIRCUIT FAILURE

para.emph: NOTE: Both circuits must be checked for each DTC.

item.para: Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Clear the Continuous DTCs
Drive the vehicle with at least 16 km/h (10 mph).

para.emph: Is DTC C1145, C1155 or C1175 retrieved?

entry.para: If any other DTCs are retrieved, GO to the Anti-Lock Brake System (ABS) Module Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC) Index.

para.emph: D2 CHECK FOR A SHORT TO VOLTAGE
NOTE: Both circuits must be checked for each DTC.

item.para: Measure the voltage between ABS module C135, harness side and ground, as follows:

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: D3 CHECK FOR A SHORT TO GROUND
NOTE: Both circuits must be checked for each DTC.

item.para: Measure the voltage between ABS module C135, harness side and ground as follows:

para.emph: Are the resistances greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit in question. CLEAR the DTCs. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: NOTE: Both circuits must be checked for each DTC.

item.para: Measure the resistance between ABS module C135, harness side and the suspected wheel speed sensor connector, harness side, as follows:

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: D5 CHECK FOR SHORTED WHEEL SPEED SENSOR CIRCUITS

item.para: Measure the resistance between the suspect front wheel speed sensor pins, harness side with the meter in the 10 megaohm range.
Measure the resistance between the rear wheel speed sensor pins, harness side with the meter in the 10 megaohm range.

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: D6 CHECK THE ABS MODULE OUTPUT

item.para: Measure the voltage between the suspect front wheel speed sensor pins, harness side.
Measure the voltage between the rear wheel speed sensor pins, harness side.

para.emph: Are the voltages greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: INSTALL a new wheel speed sensor. For the front wheel speed sensor, REFER to Front Wheel Speed Sensor in this section. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test. For the rear wheel speed sensor, REFER to Rear Wheel Speed Sensor in this section. CLEAR the DTCs. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D7 CHECK FOR CORRECT ABS MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Connect the ABS connector and make sure that it is seated correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new ABS module. REFER to Anti-Lock Brake System Module in this section. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

caution.para: Use the Probe Kit for all test connections to prevent damage to the wiring terminals. Do not use standard multimeter probes.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST E: DTC C1222 - WHEEL SPEED MISMATCH/ DTC C1233 (LF), C1234 (RF) OR C1236 (REAR) - WHEEL SPEED SENSOR SIGNAL FAULT

para.emph: Are DTCs C1145, C1155 or C1175 present?

entry.para: If DTC C1222 is present, GO to E4. If DTC C1233 or C1234 is present, GO to E2. If DTC C1236 is present, GO to E3. If no DTCs are present, GO to E5.

para.emph: E2 CHECK THE FRONT WHEEL SPEED SENSOR OUTPUT

item.para: Disconnect: Wheel Speed Sensor C150 (LF) or C160 (RF).

If DTC C1233 is present, connect a fused (5A) jumper wire between LF wheel speed sensor C150-1 , circuit 498 (PK), harness side and LF wheel speed sensor C150-1 , component side. Connect the automotive meter between LF wheel speed sensor C150-2, circuit 495 (TN), harness side and LF wheel speed sensor C150-2, component side.

If DTC C1234 is present, connect a fused (5A) jumper wire between RF wheel speed sensor C160-1 , circuit 497 (WH), harness side and RF wheel speed C160-1, component side. Connect the automotive meter between RF wheel speed sensor C160-2 , circuit 510 (TN/RD), harness side and RF wheel speed sensor C160-2, component side.
Measure the amperage while slowly spinning the wheel.

para.emph: Does the amperage vary between approximately 6 mA and 14 mA?

entry.para: INSTALL a new wheel speed sensor, REFER to Front Wheel Speed Sensor in this section. CLEAR the DTC. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: E3 CHECK THE REAR WHEEL SPEED SENSOR OUTPUT

item.para: Disconnect: Rear Wheel Speed Sensor C455.

Connect a fused (5A) jumper wire between rear wheel speed sensor, C455-1 , circuit 492 (BN), harness side and rear wheel speed sensor C455-1, component side. Connect the automotive meter between rear wheel speed sensor C455-2, circuit 494 (TN/LG), harness side and rear wheel speed sensor C455-2, component side.
Measure the amperage while slowly spinning the wheel.

para.emph: Does the amperage vary between approximately 6 mA and 14 mA?

entry.para: INSTALL a new wheel speed sensor. REFER to Rear Wheel Speed Sensor in this section. CLEAR the DTC. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: E4 CHECK FOR CORRECT ABS MODULE CONFIGURATION
NOTE: DTC C1222 indicates that there is a problem with the axle configuration in the ABS module.

item.para: Carry out the ABS module configuration. Verify that the vehicle data matches the vehicle options.
Clear the DTC and carry out the self-test.

entry.para: The system is operating correctly at this time. CLEAR the DTC. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: E5 MONITOR THE WHEEL SPEED SENSOR PID

item.para: Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: ABS Module Wheel Speed Sensor PIDs
Drive the vehicle at various speeds above 10 km/h (6 mph) while monitoring the PIDs.

para.emph: Do all of the PIDs match?

entry.para: INSTALL a new wheel speed sensor. REFER to Front Wheel Speed Sensor in this section. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: E6 CHECK FOR CORRECT ABS MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Connect the ABS connector and make sure that it is seated correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new ABS module. REFER to Anti-Lock Brake System Module in this section. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST F: DTC C1446 - BRAKE SWITCH CIRCUIT FAILURE

para.emph: F1 MONITOR THE ENGINE CONTROL MODULE (ECM) PIDs

item.para: Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: ECM PID.
Press and release the brake pedal while monitoring the ECM stoplamp switch PID.

para.emph: Does the PID agree with the brake pedal position?

entry.para:
REFER to Exterior Lighting in S08307
to continue diagnosis of the stoplamps.

para.emph: F2 MONITOR THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKE SYSTEM (ABS) MODULE STOPLAMP SWITCH PID

item.para: Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: ABS Module PID.
Press and release the brake pedal while monitoring the stoplamp switch PID.

para.emph: Does the PID agree with the brake pedal position?

entry.para: INSTALL a ABS module. REFER to Anti-lock Brake System Module in this section. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: F3 CHECK FOR CORRECT ABS MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Connect the ABS connector and make sure that it is seated correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new ABS module. REFER to Anti-Lock Brake System Module in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST G: THE YELLOW ANTI-LOCK BRAKE SYSTEM (ABS) MODULE WARNING INDICATOR IS ALWAYS ON

entry.para: If the DTCs retrieved are related to the concern, GO to the Anti-Lock Brake System (ABS) Module Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC) Index to continue diagnosis.

para.emph: G2 CARRY OUT THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER ABS WARNING INDICATOR ACTIVE COMMAND

item.para: Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Instrument Cluster Active Command.
Select the instrument cluster INDICATOR LAMP CONTROL active command.
Command all warning lamps ON then OFF.

para.emph: Does the yellow ABS warning indicator continue to illuminate?
G3 CHECK FOR CORRECT INSTRUMENT CLUSTER OPERATION

item.para: Disconnect all the instrument cluster connectors.
Connect all the instrument cluster connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. REFER to Instrument Cluster. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: G4 CHECK FOR CORRECT ABS MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Connect the ABS connector and make sure that it is seated correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new ABS module. REFER to Anti-Lock Brake System Module in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the DTCs. REPEAT the self-test.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST H: SOFT OR EXCESSIVE PEDAL TRAVEL

para.emph: H1 CHECK THE BASE BRAKE COMPONENTS

item.para: Visually inspect the brake lines from the hydraulic control unit (HCU) to the brake calipers.
Visually inspect the calipers and brake components.

para.emph: Are any of these components damaged?

entry.para: REPAIR or INSTALL new components as necessary. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: H2 CHECK FOR A LEAKING DUMP VALVE

item.para: Remove the rubber boots from the 2 HCU low pressure accumulators (LPA).
Insert a clean steel implement, (such as a paper clip or small screwdriver) into each LPA.

para.emph: NOTE: A leaking dump valve is similar to the master cylinder bypass condition. It is important that the pedal be quickly and forcefully applied to rule out master cylinder bypass as a cause. Typically, master cylinder bypass occurs only at low pedal pressure rates.

item.para: Have an assistant press hard on the brake pedal while observing the steel implements.

para.emph: Do any of the implements move out 6.35 mm (0.25 in) or more?

entry.para: INSTALL a new HCU. REFER to Hydraulic Control Unit in this section.
REMOVE the steel implements. INSTALL the rubber boots on each LPA. REFER to Brake System for diagnosis of the base brake system.
